description: This segment represents information that may be useful when sending referrals from the referring provider to the referred-to provider.

fields.name: Referral Status
fields.description: This field contains the status of the referral as defined by either the referred-to or the referred-by provider. Refer to User-defined Table 0283 - Referral statusfor suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Referral Priority
fields.description: This field contains the urgency of the referral. Refer to User-defined Table 0280 - Referral priority for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Referral Type
fields.description: This field contains the type of referral. It is loosely associated with a clinical specialty or type of resource. Refer to User-defined Table 0281 - Referral type for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Referral Disposition
fields.description: This field contains the type of response or action that the referring provider would like from the referred-to provider. Refer to User-defined Table 0282 - Referral disposition for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Referral Category
fields.description: This field contains the location at which the referral will take place. Refer to User-defined Table 0284 - Referral categor y for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: Originating Referral Identifier
fields.description: This field contains the originating applications permanent identifier for the referral. This is a composite field.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which the referral is effective.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which the referral expires.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Process Date
fields.description: This field contains the date on which the referral originated. It is used in cases of retroactive approval.

fields.name: Time
fields.description: The point in time.

fields.name: Degree Of Precision
fields.description:
Retained only for purposes of backward compatibility as of v 2.3. Refer to component 1 for current method of designating degree of precision.

Indicates the degree of precision of the time stamp (Y = year, L = month, D = day, H = hour, M = minute, S = second). Refer to HL7 Table 0529 - Precision for valid value.

fields.name: Referral Reason
fields.description: This field contains the reason for which the referral will take place. Refer to User-defined Table 0336 - Referral reason for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.description: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.description: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.description: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.description: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

fields.name: External Referral Identifier
fields.description: This field contains an external applications permanent identifier for the referral. That is, this referral identifier does not belong to the application that originated the referral and assigned the originating referral identifier.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.description: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.description: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.
